Figure `r figNum(1)` illustrates different degrees of learning loss might that
may be encountered in student growth trajectories on state summative assessments.

```{r, fig.cap = "Example learning loss illustration with a summative state assessment", out.width="100%", fig.align='center', fig.topcaption=TRUE, out.extra='data-prefix="Figure"', results="asis", echo=FALSE}

	if (tolower(params$render.format) == "bookdown") {
		tmp.fig.caption <- knitr::opts_current$get("fig.cap")
		cat(gsub("</p>\n", "</div>", gsub("<p>", "<div class='caption'>", markdown::markdownToHTML(text=Gmisc::figCapNo(tmp.fig.caption), fragment.only=TRUE))))
	}
	knitr::include_graphics(file.path(params$asset.directory, "images", "example_figure_3.png"), error = FALSE)
```

	rgroup.indx <- diff(c(which(stu_msgp[,1] != ""), (nrow(stu_msgp)+1)))
	tmp.caption <- "Median baseline and cohort SGPs for 2019 and 2021 by content area and grade"

  knitr::knit_print(
		htmlTable::htmlTable(stu_msgp,
			title="", align=paste(rep('c', ncol(stu_msgp)), collapse=""),
			tspanner=rep("", length(rgroup.indx)), n.tspanner=rgroup.indx,
	    caption=tblCap(tmp.caption)))
```

Here is an example of how to include tables for counter/caption similar to figures
in pagedown template.  If we go this route Adam will need to put this into a function
to render the table differenly in bookdown than in pagedown


```{r fig.cap="Median baseline and cohort SGPs for 2019 and 2021 by content area and grade", out.width="0", out.height="0", out.extra='data-prefix="Table"', results="asis", echo=FALSE, eval=ifelse(tolower(params$render.format) == "pagedown", TRUE, FALSE)}

	###  Include VERY small, transparent image to create table title and
	knitr::include_graphics("data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7", dpi=NA, error = FALSE)

  knitr::knit_print(
		htmlTable::htmlTable(stu_msgp,
			title="", align=paste(rep('c', ncol(stu_msgp)), collapse=""),
			tspanner=rep("", length(rgroup.indx)), n.tspanner=rgroup.indx,
	    caption=NULL, css.table="margin-top: -1.25em;margin-bottom: 1em;min-width: 75%;"))
```
